title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: bottom table hierarchy, list substances. substance, primary key pk, chemical name based IUPAC nomenclature, substance names official languages Switzerland. first four entries 440 shown .
code: library(knitr) current_register$substances |>    select(pk, iupac, substance_de, substance_fr, substance_it) |>    head(n = 4L) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: three tables defining products, pNbrs, products ingredients. P-Numbers contained table pNbrs identifiers product compositions. Products P-Number considered equivalent terms efficacy risks. table pNbrs technical reason. simply contains column holding P-Numbers.

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: composition products terms active substances, additives declare, synergists safeners defined table ingredients, giving contents percent weight per weight (percent). liquid products, content grams per litre also given (g_per_L). substance contained form differs definition given substance table, documented respective additional columns illustrated first five rows shown . frequency occurrence four different ingredient types quite different. Additives declare additives effect classification labelling product. substances occurring synergists safeners listed . Note first two lines code also replaced makes use foreign key declaration data object. However, explicit version using left_join probably easier understand.
code: current_register$ingredients |>    select(pNbr, pk, type, percent, g_per_L, ingredient_de, ingredient_fr) |>    head(n = 5L) |>    kable() library(dplyr) current_register$ingredients |>    select(pk, type) |>    unique() |>    group_by(type) |>    summarize(n = n()) |>    kable() current_register$ingredients |>    left_join(current_register$substances, by = "pk") |>   filter(type %in% c("SYNERGIST", "SAFENER")) |>   group_by(type, substance_de) |>    summarize(n = n(), .groups = "drop_last") |>    select(type, substance_de, n) |>    arrange(type, substance_de) |>    kable() current_register |>    dm_flatten_to_tbl(ingredients) |>

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: registered products identified -called W-Numbers. relation P-Numbers W-Numbers illustrated showing first five entries products table. can seen example entries, several registrations (W-Numbers) product type (P-Number) can exist. W-Numbers without dash (e.g. 18) original registrations, ones containing dash trailing number (e.g. 18-1, 18-2) equivalent products sales permissions different legal entity permission holder. product registration revoked, relevant latest dates selling product (soldoutDeadline) use product (exhaustionDeadline) given respective columns. build time vignette, 1714 product registrations 1124 P-Numbers Swiss Register Plant Protection Products (SRPPP) published website Federal Food Safety Veterinary Office.
code: current_register$products |>    select(-terminationReason) |>    head() |>    kable() current_register$products |>   filter(exhaustionDeadline != "") |>    select(-terminationReason) |>    head() |>    kable()

what: Example code for getting a product composition from a product name
title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: name product known, associated P-Numbers W-Numbers well product composition can retrieved command like following.
code: current_register$products |>   filter(name == "Plüsstar") |>   left_join(current_register$ingredients, by = "pNbr") |>   left_join(current_register$substances, by = "pk") |>   select(pNbr, name, substance_de, percent, g_per_L) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: product type (P-Number), registered uses (tagged <Indication> XML file) specified uses table. use numbers column use_nr generated reading XML file, order able refer use combination P-Number (pNbr) use number (use_nr). columns min_dosage max_dosage contain either range recommended product concentrations spraying solution percent, , min_dosage given, recommended concentration. Similarly, single recommended application rate, stored min_rate. recommended range application rates, max_rate given well. units application rate given columns starting units_. addition, required waiting period harvest can specified, well application area associated use.
code: current_register$uses |>    filter(pNbr %in% c(6521L, 7511L) & use_nr < 10) |>    select(pNbr, use_nr, ends_with("dosage"), ends_with("rate"), units_de,     waiting_period, time_units_en, application_area_de) |>    head(20) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: Application rates terms grams active substances contained products per hectare can calculated using function application_rate_g_per_ha() illustrated example . first step, uses need selected joined information ingredients table. names active substances can joined well. , application rates can calculated uses illustrated .
code: example_uses <- current_register$products |>    filter(wNbr == "6168") |>   left_join(current_register$uses, by = join_by(pNbr),     relationship = "many-to-many") |>    left_join(current_register$ingredients, by = join_by(pNbr),     relationship = "many-to-many") |>   left_join(current_register$substances, by = join_by(pk)) |>   select(pNbr, name, use_nr,     min_dosage, max_dosage, min_rate, max_rate, units_de,     application_area_de,     substance_de, percent, g_per_L) |>    filter(use_nr %in% c(1:5, 12:17))  kable(example_uses) application_rate_g_per_ha(example_uses) |>   select(ai = substance_de, app_area = application_area_de,   ends_with("rate"), units_de, rate = rate_g_per_ha) |>    head(n = 14) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: current SRPPP versions, two culture forms, greenhouse cultivation field cultivation. specific uses, e.g. uses number 1 2 product “Boxer” W-Number 6168, associated culture form registered cultures can listed shown . use typically associated one culture form, culture form actual cultures can joined use numbers one step.
code: current_register$culture_forms |>    select(starts_with("culture")) |>    unique() |>    kable() current_register$products |>    filter(wNbr == "6168") |>    left_join(current_register$uses, by = "pNbr") |>    filter(use_nr %in% 1:2) |>    left_join(current_register$culture_forms, by = c("pNbr", "use_nr")) |>    select(pNbr, use_nr, ends_with("de")) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: target organisms use can found table pests. Example code retrieving target organisms specific uses given .
code: current_register$pests |>    filter(pNbr == 7105L, use_nr %in% 1:2) |>    select(use_nr, ends_with("de"), ends_with("fr")) |>    kable()

what: Unique combinations of cultures and target organisms
title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: calculations mean application rates Swiss National Risk Indicator (Korkaric et al. 2022, 2023), unique combinations product, culture, target organism termed “indications”. Note using definition indications, XML section <Indication> can describe several indications. relation uses (<Indication> sections) indications defined indicator project illustrated . example, 25 “indications” 15 uses.
code: culture_pest_combinations <- current_register$uses |>    filter(pNbr == 6521L) |>    left_join(current_register$cultures, by = c("pNbr", "use_nr")) |>    left_join(current_register$pests, by = c("pNbr", "use_nr")) |>    select(pNbr, use_nr, application_area_de, culture_de, pest_de)  kable(culture_pest_combinations)

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: Sometimes, use specific comments can found application_comments table.
code: current_register$application_comments |>   filter(pNbr == 7105, use_nr %in% 1:2) |>    select(pNbr, use_nr, ends_with("de"), ends_with("fr")) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: use conditions use listed table obligations. following example, column sw_runoff_points selected output, use authorisations conditional risk mitigation runoff surface water amounting least one point.
code: current_register$obligations |>   filter(pNbr == 7105, use_nr %in% 1:2) |>    select(pNbr, use_nr, code, obligation_de, sw_runoff_points) |>    kable()

title: Statistics on products containing microorganisms in the latest XML dump of the SRPPP
text: following list used identify product categories containing microorganisms. resulting product categories containing microorganisms defined follows: corresponding products shown .
code: srppp$categories |>   group_by(category_de) |>   summarise(n = n()) |>   kable() microorganism_categories = c(   "Lebende Organismen (Bakterien)",   "Lebende Organismen (Pilze)",   "Lebende Organismen (gegen Pilze)") kable(data.frame(Category = microorganism_categories)) products_in_microorganism_categories <- srppp$products |>   filter(!isSalePermission) |>   left_join(srppp$categories, by = "pNbr") |>   filter(category_de %in% microorganism_categories) |>   select(pNbr, wNbr, name, category_de) |>   arrange(pNbr) n_in_categories <- nrow(products_in_microorganism_categories) kable(products_in_microorganism_categories)

title: Statistics on products containing microorganisms in the latest XML dump of the SRPPP
text: following lists active substances insecticides fungicides used establish filter criteria active substances microorganisms. following genus names established filtering criteria. results following list active ingredients. following products contain one active ingredients.
code: srppp$products |>   filter(!isSalePermission) |>   left_join(srppp$categories, by = "pNbr") |>   filter(category_de == "Insektizid") |>   left_join(srppp$ingredients, by = "pNbr", relationship = "many-to-many") |>   left_join(srppp$substances, by = "pk") |>   select(substance_de) |>   unique() |>   arrange(substance_de) |>   kable() srppp$products |>   filter(!isSalePermission) |>   left_join(srppp$categories, by = "pNbr") |>   filter(category_de == "Fungizid") |>   left_join(srppp$ingredients, by = "pNbr", relationship = "many-to-many") |>   left_join(srppp$substances, by = "pk") |>   select(substance_de) |>   unique() |>   arrange(substance_de) |>   kable() microorganism_genus_names <- c(   "Bacillus",   "Beauveria",   "Metarhizium",   "Xenorhabdus",   "Phlebia",   "Pseudomonas") kable(data.frame("Genus names" = microorganism_genus_names, check.names = FALSE)) microorganism_regexp <- paste(microorganism_genus_names, collapse = "|") microorganism_ingredients <- srppp$substances |>   filter(grepl(microorganism_regexp, substance_de)) |>   select(pk, substance_de) kable(microorganism_ingredients) additional_products_containing_microorganisms <- srppp$products |>   filter(!isSalePermission) |>   left_join(srppp$ingredients, by = "pNbr", relationship = "many-to-many") |>   filter(pk %in% microorganism_ingredients$pk) |>   select(-pk) |>   left_join(srppp$categories, by = "pNbr") |>    select(pNbr, wNbr, name, category_de) |>   arrange(pNbr) n_additional <- nrow(additional_products_containing_microorganisms) kable(additional_products_containing_microorganisms)

title: Statistics on products containing microorganisms in the latest XML dump of the SRPPP
text: summary, 1714 products, 21 microorganism categories shown , 48 products insecticide fungicide categories contain active substance name contains one microorganism genus names listed . consolidated list 42 unique products identified way shown . products listed twice, identified via ways.
code: products_containing_microorganisms <- rbind(   products_in_microorganism_categories,    additional_products_containing_microorganisms) |>   arrange(pNbr, category_de) |>   unique() n_unique <- length(unique(products_containing_microorganisms$pNbr)) kable(products_containing_microorganisms)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Marcel Mathis. Contributor, reviewer. Romualdus Kasteel. Reviewer.           Provided feedback version 0.3.4 Daniel Baumgartner. Contributor.           Provided feedback, explanations background information Johannes Ranke. Author, maintainer. Agroscope. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ranke J (2024). srppp: Swiss Register Plant Protection Products R Package. R package version 0.99.2, https://agroscope-ch.github.io/srppp.
code: @Manual{,   title = {srppp: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as an R Package},   author = {Johannes Ranke},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.99.2},   url = {https://agroscope-ch.github.io/srppp}, }

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as an R Package
text: Functions generate data objects XML versions Swiss Register Plant Protection Products (SRPPP). online version register can accessed https://www.psm.admin.ch/de/produkte. guarantee correspondence data read using package online version, original registration documents. Also, Federal Food Safety Veterinary Office, coordinating authorisation plant protection products Switzerland, answer requests regarding package.

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as an R Package
code: install.packages("srppp",   repos = c("https://agroscope-ch.r-universe.dev", "https://cran.r-project.org"))

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as an R Package
text: online version documentation current development version package available github.

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as an R Package

what: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
text: function searches uses given list active substances reports either table uses number available alternative products use, detailed table alternative product uses, table uses without alternatives, list containing three tables.

title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
code: alternative_products(   srppp,   active_ingredients,   details = FALSE,   missing = FALSE,   list = FALSE,   lang = c("de", "fr", "it") )

title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
text: srppp srppp_dm object. active_ingredients Character vector active ingredient names matched column 'substances_de' srppp table 'substances'. details table alternative uses 'wNbr' 'use_nr' returned? missing set TRUE, uses without alternative product registrations listed. list TRUE, list three tables returned, table uses without alternative products ("Lückenindikationen"), table number alternative products use, , detailed table alternative uses. argument overrides arguments 'details' 'missing'. lang language used active ingredient names returned tables.

title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
text: use defined combination application area, crop ('culture') pathogen ('pest').

title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ sr <- srppp_dm()  actives_de <- c("Lambda-Cyhalothrin", "Deltamethrin")  alternative_products(sr, actives_de) alternative_products(sr, actives_de, missing = TRUE) alternative_products(sr, actives_de, details = TRUE) alternative_products(sr, actives_de, list = TRUE)  # Example in Italian actives_it <- c("Lambda-Cialotrina", "Deltametrina") alternative_products(sr, actives_it, lang = "it") } # }

what: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: application rate g active substance/ha calculated information dosage (product concentration application solution), application volume, directly product application rate. complicated fact rate ("expenditure" XML file) units l/ha can refer application solution liquid product.

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
code: application_rate_g_per_ha(   product_uses,   aggregation = c("max", "mean", "min"),   dosage_units = c("percent_ww", "percent_vv", "state_of_matter"),   skip_l_per_ha_without_g_per_L = TRUE,   fix_l_per_ha = TRUE )

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: product_uses tibble containing columns 'pNbr', 'use_nr', 'application_area_de', 'min_dosage', 'max_dosage', 'min_rate', 'max_rate', 'uses' table srppp_dm object, well columns 'percent' 'g_per_L' 'ingredients' table srppp_dm object. aggregation represent range present, e.g. "max" (default) "mean". dosage_units units given, units "%", applied amount g/ha calculated using reference application volume dosage. dosage units explicitly given, can specify assumptions using argument (currently implemented, .e. specifying argument effect). skip_l_per_ha_without_g_per_L Per default, uses use rate units l/ha skipped, product concentration g/L. also done 2023 indicator project. fix_l_per_ha review 2023 indicator project calculations, number cases identified unit l/ha specifies water volume, product volume. TRUE (default), cases corrected, FALSE, cases discarded.

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: tibble containing one additional column 'rate_g_per_ha'

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: cases (currently one), external information found, indicating "expenditure" application volume l_per_ha_is_water_volume.

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: reference application volume used 'expenditure'. selected based product application area. correct hops ('Hopfen') culture, unique reference application volume 3000 L/ha. Applications hops excluded calculating mean use rates indicator project (Korkaric 2023), arguing grown large areas Switzerland.

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(srppp) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(dm, warn.conflicts = FALSE) sr <- srppp_dm()  product_uses_with_ingredients <- sr$substances |>   filter(substance_de %in% c("Halauxifen-methyl", "Kupfer (als Kalkpr\u00E4parat)")) |>   left_join(sr$ingredients, by = "pk") |>   left_join(sr$uses, by = "pNbr") |>   left_join(sr$products, by = "pNbr") |>   select(pNbr, name, use_nr,     min_dosage, max_dosage, min_rate, max_rate, units_de,     application_area_de,     substance_de, percent, g_per_L)  application_rate_g_per_ha(product_uses_with_ingredients) |>   filter(name %in% c("Cerelex", "Pixxaro EC", "Bordeaux S")) |>   select(ai = substance_de, app_area = application_area_de,     min_d = min_dosage,  max_d = max_dosage,     min_r = min_rate, max_r = max_rate,     units_de, rate = rate_g_per_ha) |>   print(n = Inf) } # }

what: srppp: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as an R Package — srppp-package
title: srppp: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as an R Package — srppp-package
text: Functions generate data objects XML versions Swiss Register Plant Protection Products 'SRPPP'. online version register can accessed https://www.psm.admin.ch/de/produkte. guarantee correspondence data read using package online version, original registration documents. Also, Federal Food Safety Veterinary Office, coordinating authorisation plant protection products Switzerland, answer requests regarding package.

title: srppp: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as an R Package — srppp-package
text: Maintainer: Johannes Ranke johannes.ranke@agroscope.admin.ch (ORCID) contributors: Marcel Mathis marcel.mathis@agroscope.admin.ch [contributor, reviewer] Romualdus Kasteel romualdus.kasteel@agroscope.admin.ch (Provided feedback version 0.3.4) [reviewer] Daniel Baumgartner (Provided feedback, explanations background information) [contributor] Agroscope [copyright holder]

title: Create a dm object from an XML version of the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp_dm
text: Information products duplicated across several products sharing P-Number associated directly P-Number, order avoid duplications. reading XML file, checked resulting deduplication remove data. cases historical XML files, two <Product> sections sharing W-Number. cases, one apparently included error informed decision taken reading data one sections discarded. details procedure can found source code function srppp_xml_get_products.

title: Create a dm object from an XML version of the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp_dm
text: table obligations, following information mitigation measures extracted ones relevant environment (SPe 3). "sw_drift_dist": Unsprayed buffer towards surface waters mitigate spray drift meters "sw_runoff_dist": Vegetated buffer towards surface waters mitigate runoff meters "sw_runoff_points": Required runoff mitigation points mitigate runoff "biotope_drift_dist": Unsprayed buffer towards biotopes (defined articles 18a 18b Federal Act Protection Nature Cultural Heritage) mitigate spray drift meters

title: Create a dm object from an XML version of the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp_dm
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(dm, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  sr <- srppp_dm() dm_examine_constraints(sr) #> ℹ All constraints satisfied. if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ dm_draw(sr)  } # }  # Show ingredients for products named 'Boxer' sr$products |>   filter(name == "Boxer") |>   left_join(sr$ingredients, by = "pNbr") |>   left_join(sr$substances, by = "pk") |>   select(wNbr, name, pNbr, isSalePermission, substance_de, g_per_L) #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   wNbr   name   pNbr isSalePermission substance_de g_per_L #>   <chr>  <chr> <int> <lgl>            <chr>          <dbl> #> 1 6168   Boxer  7105 FALSE            Prosulfocarb     800 #> 2 6168-1 Boxer  7105 TRUE             Prosulfocarb     800  # Show authorised uses of the original product boxer_uses <- sr$products |>   filter(name == "Boxer", !isSalePermission) |>   left_join(sr$uses, by = "pNbr") |>   select(pNbr, use_nr,     min_dosage, max_dosage, min_rate, max_rate, units_de,     waiting_period, time_units_de, application_area_de) print(boxer_uses) #> # A tibble: 17 × 10 #>     pNbr use_nr min_dosage max_dosage min_rate max_rate units_de waiting_period #>    <int>  <int>      <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>             <int> #>  1  7105      1         NA         NA      5       NA   l/ha                100 #>  2  7105      2         NA         NA      5       NA   l/ha                 60 #>  3  7105      3         NA         NA      5       NA   l/ha                 90 #>  4  7105      4         NA         NA      4       NA   l/ha                 80 #>  5  7105      5         NA         NA      2.5      3   l/ha                 75 #>  6  7105      6         NA         NA      4       NA   l/ha                 80 #>  7  7105      7         NA         NA      3       NA   l/ha                 80 #>  8  7105      8         NA         NA      3       NA   l/ha                 80 #>  9  7105      9         NA         NA      4       NA   l/ha                 80 #> 10  7105     10         NA         NA      5       NA   l/ha                  0 #> 11  7105     11         NA         NA      4       NA   l/ha                  0 #> 12  7105     12         NA         NA      3        4.5 l/ha                  0 #> 13  7105     13         NA         NA      2.5      5   l/ha                 NA #> 14  7105     14         NA         NA      3        5   l/ha                 NA #> 15  7105     15         NA         NA      5       NA   l/ha                  0 #> 16  7105     16         NA         NA      4       NA   l/ha                 60 #> 17  7105     17         NA         NA      2.5      5   l/ha                 NA #> # ℹ 2 more variables: time_units_de <chr>, application_area_de <chr>  # Show crop for use number 1 boxer_uses |>   filter(use_nr == 1) |>   left_join(sr$cultures, join_by(pNbr, use_nr)) |>   select(use_nr, culture_de) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   use_nr culture_de      #>    <int> <chr>           #> 1      1 Knollensellerie  # Show target pests for use number 1 boxer_uses |>   filter(use_nr == 1) |>   left_join(sr$pests, join_by(pNbr, use_nr)) |>   select(use_nr, pest_de) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   use_nr pest_de                               #>    <int> <chr>                                 #> 1      1 Einjährige Dicotyledonen (Unkräuter)  #> 2      1 Einjährige Monocotyledonen (Ungräser)  # Show obligations for use number 1 boxer_uses |>   filter(use_nr == 1) |>   left_join(sr$obligations, join_by(pNbr, use_nr)) |>   select(use_nr, sw_runoff_points, obligation_de) |>   knitr::kable() |>   print() #>  #>  #> | use_nr|sw_runoff_points |obligation_de                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | #> |------:|:----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| #> |      1|NA               |Nachbau anderer Kulturen: 16 Wochen Wartefrist.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | #> |      1|NA               |Nachfolgearbeiten in behandelten Kulturen: bis 48 Stunden nach Ausbringung des Mittels Schutzhandschuhe + Schutzanzug tragen.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | #> |      1|NA               |Maximal 1 Behandlung pro Kultur.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | #> |      1|NA               |Ansetzen der Spritzbrühe: Schutzhandschuhe tragen. Ausbringen der Spritzbrühe: Schutzhandschuhe + Schutzanzug + Visier + Kopfbedeckung tragen. Technische Schutzvorrichtungen während des Ausbringens (z.B. geschlossene Traktorkabine) können die vorgeschriebene persönliche Schutzausrüstung ersetzen, wenn gewährleistet ist, dass sie einen vergleichbaren oder höheren Schutz bieten. | #> |      1|1                |SPe 3: Zum Schutz von Gewässerorganismen muss das Abschwemmungsrisiko gemäss den Weisungen der Zulassungsstelle um 1 Punkt reduziert werden.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | #> |      1|NA               |Splitbehandlung gemäss den Angaben der Bewilligungsinhaberin (max. 3 l/ha je Split, angegebene Aufwandmenge entspricht total bewilligter Menge).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | #> |      1|NA               |Phytotoxschäden bei empfindlichen Arten oder Sorten möglich; vor allgemeiner Anwendung Versuchspritzung durchführen.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | #> |      1|NA               |Bewilligt als geringfügige Verwendung nach Art. 35 PSMV (minor use).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |  # Show application comments for use number 1 boxer_uses |>   filter(use_nr == 1) |>   left_join(sr$application_comments, join_by(pNbr, use_nr)) |>   select(use_nr, application_comment_de) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   use_nr application_comment_de       #>    <int> <chr>                        #> 1      1 "7 Tage nach dem Pflanzen. "

title: Get Products from an XML version of the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp_xml_get_products
text: srppp_xml object returned 'srppp_xml_get' verbose give feedback? remove_duplicates duplicates based wNbrs removed? set 'TRUE', one two entries identical wNbrs removed, based investigation background information carried package authors. cases except one, one product sections duplicate wNbrs information expiry registration, . cases registration without expiry kept, expiring registration discarded. remaining case (wNbr 5945), second entry selected, contains indications apparently intended published well.

title: Get Products from an XML version of the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp_xml_get_products
text: tibble::tibble row product section XML file. attribute 'duplicated_wNbrs' also returned, containing duplicated W-Numbers, applicable, NULL.

title: version 0.99.2
text: R/srppp-xml.R: Revise structure srppp_dm object, verifying product sections different products P-Number identical, exception permission holder. Therefore, tables describing products, including use definitions, now tied pNbrs table pNbr primary key, instead products table wNbr primary key. Functions, example code, vignettes tests adapted accordingly.

title: version 0.99.1
text: vignettes/srppp.rmd: Add overview vignette displayed link ‘Get started’ online documentation

title: version 0.3.4
text: Rename package ‘psmv’ ‘srppp’

title: version 0.3.3
text: Remove redundant information ingredients table removing W-Numbers containing dash. P-Numbers added ingredient table well, product compositions can easily obtained using ingredients table. Finally remove W-Numbers ingredients table. consequence, products ingredients must now joined ‘pNbr’, relationship ‘many--many’, ‘pNbr’ can occur products table. grouping products table P-Numbers removed, seemed used anywhere created spurious messages constraint checking.
